messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where º Uº  R???
messages.msgSnippet: his train what kinda train???  We don t have Amtrac through here because they are warring with the feds and state about fixing the tracks.  They do have the
messages.messageBody:
"his train" what kinda train??? We don't have Amtrac through here because
they are warring with the feds and state about fixing the tracks. They do
have the Amtrac bus route right through town, does he want to drive a bus
<g>

Lynda, who always likes to be helpful <g>

----------

> To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where º Uº R???
> Date: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 8:34 AM

>

MOVING

better

too

>
> Pris

cats

> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Lynda" <lurine@...>
> To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 10:38 AM
> Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where ºUº R???
> >
> > Well, not to make it too terrible for ya, Pris, but we live in an area
> that
> > has the average temp for the whole U.S. which means it runs about 67
> > degrees all year. We only vary by about 10 degrees in either direction
> and
> > only have about a dozen frost days a year. The little town "next door"
> has
> > the most growing days in a year for the whole country.
> >
> > However, we can usually drive down the road a bit (half hour to an
hour)
> > and be in some friendly (80 to 90's) heat in one direction and serious
> heat
> > (90's and up) in the other. But, this year we didn't get the
"friendly"
> > heat to often on the river which was a disappointment to the kidlets.
> >
> > And going up the hill to the hotter temps was kinda limited as last
year
> we
> > lost 100,000 acres to a fire compliments of the parks boozos and one of
> > their controlled burns.
> >
> > Lynda
>
